tool.name: mOTUs_profiler
tool.description: performs taxonomic profiling of metagenomics and metatrancriptomics samples
tool.command:
#if $db.db_source == 'cached' #set $DATABASE_DIR=$db.db_cached.fields.path #else #set $database_path = $db.database mkdir database_dir && tar -xvf '$database_path' -C database_dir/ && #set $DATABASE_DIR = 'database_dir/db_mOTU' ##the actual DB folder in the archive called db_mOTU #end if echo "Database Directory:" $DATABASE_DIR &&
motus profile -t \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-8} -n '$sample_name' -db '$DATABASE_DIR' #if $inputs.input_type.selector == 'reads' #if $inputs.input_type.reads_type.selector == 'paired' -f '${inputs.input_type.reads_type.forward_reads}' -r '${inputs.input_type.reads_type.reverse_reads}' #elif $inputs.input_type.reads_type.selector == 'single' -s '${inputs.input_type.reads_type.unpaired_reads}'
#elif $input_type.selector == 'SAM_BAM_input' -i '${inputs.input_type.SAM_BAM_input}' #elif $input_type.selector == 'mgc_read_count' -m '${inputs.input_type.mgc_read_count}' #end if #end if #if $algorithm_advanced_options.advanced_options.customize_algorithm_options == 'customize' -g $algorithm_advanced_options.advanced_options.marker_genes_cutoff -l $algorithm_advanced_options.advanced_options.minimum_alignment_len -v $algorithm_advanced_options.advanced_options.verbosity_level_selection -y $algorithm_advanced_options.advanced_options.read_count_type_selection #end if #if $additional_options.advanced == "advanced" $additional_options.advanced.ref_motus_only $additional_options.advanced.full_species_name $additional_options.advanced.result_as_counts $additional_options.advanced.ncbi_taxonomy_ids $additional_options.advanced.biom_format $additional_options.advanced.cami_format_option $additional_options.advanced.full_rank_taxonomy $additional_options.advanced.taxonomic_level_metaphlanType $additional_options.advanced.taxonomic_level_option #end if > '${mOTUs_profile}'

param.name: selector
param.label: Input file(s)
param.option: SAM/BAM input file(s) generated by motus map_tax
mgc_read_count file(s) generated by motus cal-mgc

param.name: forward_reads
param.label: Forward Reads
param.help: -f Input file(s) for reads in forward orientation, fastq(.gz)-formatted

param.name: reverse_reads
param.label: Reverse Reads
param.help: -r Input file(s) for reads in reverse orientation, fastq(.gz)-formatted

param.name: unpaired_reads
param.label: Unpaired reads
param.help: -s input file(s) for unpaired reads, fastq(.gz)-formatted

param.name: SAM_BAM_input
param.label: motus map_tax SAM or BAM file
param.help: -i SAM or BAM input file(s) generated by motus map_tax

param.name: mgc_count
param.label: mgc read count file)(s)
param.help: -m mgc reads count file generated by motus calc_mgc

param.name: sample_name
param.label: Sample name
param.help: sample name can contain letters and/or numbers

param.name: db_cached
param.label: A pre-installed mOTUs databese
param.help: no pre-installed mOTUs databases are avalable yet

param.name: database
param.label: Database from history
param.help: Custom database or other version of mOTUs database from link: https://zenodo.org/records/5140350

param.name: ref_motus_only
param.label: only species with reference genomes
param.help: -e only species with reference genomes (ref-mOTUs).

param.name: full_species_name
param.label: print the full name of the species
param.help: -u print the full name of the species.

param.name: result_as_counts
param.label: print result as counts
param.help: -c print result as counts instead of relative abundances.

param.name: ncbi_taxonomy_ids
param.label: print NCBI taxonomy identifiers
param.help: -p print NCBI taxonomy identifiers.

param.name: biom_format
param.label: print result in BIOM format
param.help: -B print result in BIOM format.

param.name: cami_format
param.label: print result in CAMI format
param.help: -C print result in CAMI format (BioBoxes format 0.9.1).

param.name: full_rank_taxonomy
param.label: print the full rank taxonomy
param.help: -q print the full rank taxonomy.

param.name: taxonomic_level_metaphlantype
param.label: print all taxonomic levels together_metaphlan type
param.help: -A print all taxonomic levels together (kingdom to mOTUs, override -k).

param.name: taxonomic_level
param.label: taxonomic_level
param.help: -k taxonomic level.

param.name: marker_genes_cutoff
param.label: Select number of marker genes cutoff
param.help: -g Select number of marker genes cutoff: 1=higher recall, 6=higher precision

param.name: minimum_alignment_len
param.label: Minimum Alignment Length (bp)
param.help: Specify the desired minimum alignment length in base pairs

param.name: verbosity_level_selection
param.label: verbosity level
param.help: -v verbosity level: 1=error, 2=warning, 3=message, 4+=debugging

param.name: read_count_type_selection
param.label: slect tyepe of read counts
param.help: -y type of read counts Values: [base.coverage, insert.raw_counts, insert.scaled_counts]

tool.help:
What it does ============
The mOTUs profiler is a tool designed for taxonomic profiling of metagenomic and metatranscriptomic data. It allows for the identification and quantification of microbial community composition directly from sequencing reads. mOTUs utilizes a database of marker genes identified across a wide range of microbial taxa, enabling the detection of known and unknown microorganisms in your sample data.
Additional Resources ====================
For a more comprehensive understanding of mOTUs and detailed usage instructions, please visit the mOTUs GitHub repository:
mOTUs GitHub Repository: [https://github.com/motu-tool/mOTUs](https://github.com/motu-tool/mOTUs)
